website_summaries.verdict: An affordable Corsair mid-tower case with a unique look suitable for gaming PC builds.
pros: Included LEDs shine colors through the vents and windowed side panel
Large 240-millimeter front fan draws air in directly onto the CPU and components
cons: The angular front panel is difficult to mount correctly after accessing the interior compartment

customer_reviews.title: It's a great eye catcher and cool design I love this tower
customer_reviews.text: It's a great eye catcher and cool design I love this tower, I think the only complaint I could have with this tower is that it is pretty small inside and not much room for extra things. No room for liquid cooled CPU, some room behind the panels for cable management but the SSD slots inside do not work if you have a long GPU like my 1070 triple fan Gigabyte. But no problems here besides those small inconvenience. (:
customer_reviews.author: Turbo Fingerz

customer_reviews.title: The EVO 212 fits in the SPEC-02, not the SPEC-01
customer_reviews.text: SPEC-02 + EVO 212 = happiness! I bought this case because I had a Frankenstein's Monster of a case that was too small for my EVO 212. The SPEC also has nice filters over all the intake vents which is great. The fatal flaw is the very tight space at the top of the case. My Z77 motherboard has three power connectors that interfere slightly with the 120mm output fans I mounted at the top. i5-3570K @ 4.4GHz 29C while typing this review.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Drews

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Amazing! One of the best looking cases so far! Extremely easy(not necessarily toolless if screws are fixed so tight) to open. Fantastic quality, both inside and outside. Three fans come included, one in the rear has no led light. Changed it myself.
customer_reviews.author: Heng Yang

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, few things off though
customer_reviews.text: First of all, the case looks amazing. But i have a few issues with it, the first of which being how long it takes to remove the glass side panel. It also is slightly lacking in cable management space. But other than that this case is very nice.
customer_reviews.author: pharmnan

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for, but it's still GOOD
customer_reviews.text: This case looks cool and all, but it's not SUPER efficient. Has all screws you need for specific hardware, but the airflow for it is poor, the plastic is kinda cheap, and I'm pretty sure it's not compatible for water cooling, but this one is no biggie. In the future I'm definitely changing my computer case, but for now I'm fine with this as my current case, since I've had it for about 2 years with no problems. But I advise that you clean out the dust every few months, as it could cause airflow issues.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Arango

customer_reviews.title: No airflow. Very hot
customer_reviews.text: There is no way for air to come in the front, it simply recirculates. so much heat is trapped in the case that the sides of the case get noticeably warm to the touch I tried to mount a top mount radiator in a desperate attempt to get heat out of the case. the case cannot support a top mount radiator. if you mount a front mount radiator there is no where for air to get to it aside from the tiny inlet on the front so most of the air it gets it recirculates from the top of the case. despite how good it looks I will be returning it and getting something functional.
customer_reviews.author: Yohanan

customer_reviews.title: Motherboard standoffs are not standard 3mm.
customer_reviews.text: Because of another review complaining about the motherboard studs being stripped I ordered a "Screws & Standoffs Set Assortment Kit" with this case and sure enough I needed it. What I found is the standoffs in the case are 3.5mm instead of the normal 3mm. Funny thing is the case comes with 3mm screws for the motherboard but they do not work. I had to use 3.5mm screws from the assortment kit that were supposed to be for hard drive mounting. I used Corsair CW-9060007-WW Hydro cpu cooler and the radiator does sit low when mounting out the back which caused me to install the GPU in the lower slot. Everything else seemed flawless and I would recommend this case.
customer_reviews.author: Elvis

customer_reviews.title: Stunning
customer_reviews.text: This is an absolutely gorgeous case. I've read that cooling isn't the best, but I'm not really running anything too extreme (i5, Geforce 1050, no overclocking) and it seems fine to me. Bought this to upgrade from an old, generic, black tower to something that would add a little pizzazz to my home office. This does not disappoint. It's attractive while the machine is asleep and just plain gorgeous when it comes to life and the case lights illuminate.
customer_reviews.author: D. Flores

customer_reviews.title: Probably the coolest unmodded case you can ever own
customer_reviews.text: Hands down the coolest case I've ever seen. I will say there's a few things you sacrifice for these looks, like less front case airflow compared to the mesh version, as well as no PSU shroud and a somewhat cramped back panel for that thick PSU power cord, but this thing looks so good I don't even care. Holds my parts great, looks better, and case temps are great with five fans inside. Big head turner and my only regret is not saving up for the RGB version. But at the same time, I don't have much desire to change the red glow. It's incredible.
customer_reviews.author: wolfy

customer_reviews.title: Best case ever Great spacing
customer_reviews.text: Best case ever Great spacing, cable management and quality of materials. Everyone who has seen it is getting the same one - clean and really well built for the money. Only minor issues -- Light on the front was really bright - but you can just unplug it Will be replacing the allen head bolts in the glass side with some thumb screws for convenience. - be careful with the rubber grommets as they pop out easily.
customer_reviews.author: Pro Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Good case, small spacing issue with GPU
customer_reviews.text: Good case, plenty of space for everything. I ran into an issue with mine where my GTX 1080 did not quite fit in the case due to the grills on the side for the GPU output. They did not match the spacing with my X370 ASRock motherboard, so I had to make some modifications with a pair of plyers(ripped out the flimsy metal that was in the way). Otherwise a great case, no issues with spacing at all and the modification was very easy to make.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: I mean, I've never built myself a "gaming rig", so I thought it was time to grab a love it or hate it type case, and finally build the PC that 15 year old me would be proud of. For some reason, I really liked the looks of the case (It kind of looks like a Portal Gun Turret, doesn't it?). Asthetics aside, easy to build, good construction, tool less design, the HDD mounting is super easy, and lots of options for cable management. It's a little big, but it is a full size ATX case, and I like the fan layout, and it's pretty silent when you're not stressing it. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch Green

customer_reviews.title: This case is a good DIY case
customer_reviews.text: This case is a good DIY case. It comes with enough spacers to mount full MBs. I use all six fan mounts and my system is never hot. I use the two disc slots because I like to run DVDs. If using hard drives, face them to the back of the case (better cable mgt.). I don't use the SSD slots but my PWM hub sits on them. My only negative: the thumb screws are CHEAP. One was crooked and was difficult to use. I ended up using my old systems screws. I give this 5 stars because the price is right and the tower made my build easy.
customer_reviews.author: nanmka

customer_reviews.title: Would highly recommend, but there are better cases out there.
customer_reviews.text: This is a really great case for the price. I like the fact that it came with 3 included fans, it's easy to take the panels off and access everything quickly. There's a control switch on the front for case fan speed. The only thing I don't like was building in it, if you decide to build in this case, you will know what I mean. Not enough to take a star off though. There are better cases out there.
customer_reviews.author: JKees

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived missing a screw that attaches the front IO panel to the case. I have yet to find a replacement screw that fits. "No-tool" setup for hard drives is a hassle. Plastic lever keeps popping off. A case doesn't have to do a whole lot!
customer_reviews.author: M. F. Brink

customer_reviews.title: STANDOFF SCREWS!!
customer_reviews.text: I like the case and everything, but a key part of the case is standoff screws which came preinstalled which is awesome. But about half of the screws were stripped and they only provide you with 1 extra. With such an important part of the case being useless that kinda ruins the case. Luckily i could move around some screws that did work and had an extra screw from a previous build. But still corsair... seriously?
customer_reviews.author: Kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great value for money. But...
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Great sturdy case. Plenty of room. Deep and wide-enough. Much better than the cases most store PCs come in with. I love the red fans, some people hate them, I am not one of those people. Plenty of USB 3.0 ports. Love it!The drive bays for HDD and SSD are perfect. Great value for money. Cons: It would be nice if the right side had more room for passing cords through. Also a beeper for BIOS would be good. No SD card slots, which is obsolete anyways but kinda handy.
customer_reviews.author: ZeeZee

customer_reviews.title: Corsair parts incompatible!!
customer_reviews.text: I got this case for a recent build and really like it. It looks very good and the perfect size. I was disappointed tho when I installed the Corsair H60 as a cooler. You would think it would be compatible with a popular case from Corsair. I installed it on the back of the case which was the place it should be designed for. It did NOT fit there. I had to use a hacksaw and a grinder on the case to make it fit. I thought that was a poor reflection on the design of one since both was Corsair. I did make it work, but it took some work. I love the case, tho.
customer_reviews.author: Louie M

customer_reviews.title: the case fan stopped working that was on the inside top
customer_reviews.text: only came with 2 fans the front red led fan and the top case fan, the top case fan has stopped even turning , the fan is totally clean but it wont turn , i took it out of the case and tried to manually spin the fan and it wont spin much at all , very disappointed
customer_reviews.author: Angelastar

customer_reviews.title: Excellent case and plenty of room
customer_reviews.text: Excellent case and plenty of room. I ran a full size everything in this case and I was able to clean up all the wires quite nicely and had no issues fitting components. Plenty of room behind the back panel for wire management and well though out access for making connections. Nice solid construction with enough room for 4 additional fans (two on side and two up front) with a Corsair Hydro H100i GTX up top. Just know that this case is HEAVY and even through it has some nice grab handles, I wouldn't want to lug this thing around anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: 20 degrees cooler!
customer_reviews.text: Wow where do I start? This case is breathtaking, powerful, and does more than advertised. Before I purchased this case I had a mini-tower gaming case with poor air-flow that would ALWAYS overheat. However, when I transferred all the parts over to this new case I noticed a dramatic change from averaging 84-90 degrees Celsius all the way down to averaging around 70-74 Celsius. For the price this deal can't be beat.
customer_reviews.author: Blake

customer_reviews.title: If you can get one that was cut properly it's not a bad case.
customer_reviews.text: The side panel doesn't line up right so therefore the screws don't go in correctly. I didn't realize it until it was too late due to the fact this was the first part I bought (End of Dec) and didn't finish the build until Feb 20th... I'd contact Corsair but sending me a new side panel would not fix this as I've had to force it into position for it to stay in place. So the actual screw holes are a little messed up now too. Will be replacing ASAP. If you can get one that was cut properly it's not a bad case... If... Good luck.
customer_reviews.author: Jason H

customer_reviews.title: Great case but I wish I didnt have to use ...
customer_reviews.text: Great case but I wish I didnt have to use an allen wrench to open glass, one of the screws is already stripped. Still great case with lots of room. Air flow ould be better but its fine with more fans/ liquid cooling.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Wolcott

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Case
customer_reviews.text: Case has tons of room for a motherboard of any size. You can add more fans if you would like (you should, in my opinion). For its price this was definitely a steal, considering there are cases for the same price that don't match up to this one. The overall quality of the case is good. It seems very tough and can handle drops and stuff like that without severe damage to the case itself.
customer_reviews.author: Safa

customer_reviews.title: Awesome mid tower case, but....
customer_reviews.text: This is a great case...unfortunately I really needed a full tower case for the two radiators I purchased for cooling my CPU and GPU. Quality is perfect but unfortunately had to return . Purchased another Corsair case from a different website.
customer_reviews.author: CWW1964

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Case has it all! Except... the glass is held on by Allen wrench screws that easily strip :/ It’s worth it I guess but I wish they used something more user friendly Imagine need to search for an L wrench anytime you need to open your PC It’s ridiculous! I digress, the case is GORGEOUS and the cable management is fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: UnboxTherapy

customer_reviews.title: You need a new case? This is it. I've done the hours of comparing already.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased the SPEC-02 model. Comes with two fans, front and back. Plenty of space for more fans(one front, two top). -There's an intended bulge on the side panel which allows for hiding cables behind the motherboard which is really nice. -Spots for two SSD. But plenty of internal bays for more hard drives. Overall very spacious. My previous case is slightly larger on the outside, but this case seems to have way more room inside. **Bonus little detail people might have not noticed: The restart button is slightly harder to press than the power button. I'm assuming this was intentional to reduce accidental restarts.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Great looking case!
customer_reviews.text: I love the look of the case. That is what drew me to it in the first place. The lack of space for optical drives didn't bother me one bit since I wasn't going for that anyway. Only reason it got one less star from me is because there is little space for cable management. Maybe I'm just not as good at cable management than I could be, but I just couldn't manage to route all my cables from the back. I'll keep working on it but then this is a smaller case.
customer_reviews.author: R. Hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Corsair, come on I know this is entry level, but dang.
customer_reviews.text: Bad design, cable management depends on your ingenuity. I bought this case to house my streaming computer, hahhhhhh. Not enough plug-ins to house everything a motherboard will need, also, why are they still making these cheap back plating for the plug ins for the monitors sound etc etc, I had to go pick one up from frys to get one that actually fit the case. .
customer_reviews.author: Corey White

customer_reviews.title: Decent - Too expensive
customer_reviews.text: Though this case is made with decent quality materials, I think it could have more work done on it. Grommets for cable management, and the power button feels extremely cheap. I have owned this case for a year and a half now, and ever sense the month I've got it I was thinking about getting a new case, granted being young with no job makes the difficult. I feel you would be better off getting the nzxt s340, about $10 more, but much better quality. The cable management in this case is pretty awful, same as the noise level. Over all decent.
customer_reviews.author: David B. Fletcher

customer_reviews.title: Nice case, but a little cramped for the build I was doing.
customer_reviews.text: Nice well deigned case, but easily crowded with a large GPU or dual card configuration. I would recommend that you carefully size the GPU and any liquid cooling system you wish to install before making the final decision on the case.
customer_reviews.author: D. Richner

customer_reviews.title: ... took so long for this review I bought this like a year ago from you guys its a really ...
customer_reviews.text: Sorry it took so long for this review I bought this like a year ago from you guys its a really great case I like the legs it has it makes it like a video game console and makes it easier to set on the floor without worrying about the pc being over heated I was finally able to build my computer a couple weeks ago the case was really handy and I hope it will last me many years.
customer_reviews.author: kevin kraus

customer_reviews.title: Midtower with a tight fit.
customer_reviews.text: Gave it 4 stars. Description makes it sound like it can accommodate anything. IT doesn't. Becareful with big CPU fans, large TI cards, and lots of cables. This build was for the wife and the CPU fan is hitting the side panel but that's ok. Overall doable but a tight fit which affecting airflow all the fans in the world can't help you if there is no breathing room inside of the case.
customer_reviews.author: Marco Antonio Cuevas

customer_reviews.title: Really is just a great design for a good price
customer_reviews.text: Really is just a great design for a good price. This was perfect for me as I wanted something that looked sleek, sharp, and high quality, but without looking too flashy or alien. My only real complaint is the lack of more USB ports on the front, but I'm not going to hold that against Corsair since I know they were going for a minimalist design while keeping prices down. Plus you can always get more USB ports to attach to your motherboard via PCIe.
customer_reviews.author: Truitt Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Great for single video card.
customer_reviews.text: The case is good for the price. Installing HDD, SSD, and optical drives are a breeze. The one thing that bothered me is the size. The HDD rack is in the way for anyone wanting to install a huge gtx1060 with a motherboard with more than one slot available. If you want dual cards, this case won't work. If you don't plan on using multiple cards, it'll fit one!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Nice mid-tower for the price.
customer_reviews.text: Nice size for a mid-tower. The included fans work well. It came with zip ties and all the screws you need. I just wish the picture of the screws that tell you which ones are used for each part was better. Two of the screw pictures were exactly the same, but the screws themselves look a bit different. Thankfully, I figured out which screws went with what. The cut outs for hiding your wires also works nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Leah M.

customer_reviews.title: A good value if a somewhat tight fit for some components
customer_reviews.text: Excellent airflow (you'll want to go ahead and get the additional fans to fill it out), but a pretty tight fit for the Corsair H100i V2 CPU water cooler, at least with the ASUS ROG Maximus IX Hero LGA1151 DDR4 DP HDMI M.2 USB 3.1 ATX Motherboard.
customer_reviews.author: Gordon Runkle

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, Bad cable management
customer_reviews.text: Once I was done it looked great but building it.... It was overall decent until I got to the cables part. The next day after building I spent 3 hours on just CLOSING the back. I would take a picture back there but I might not be able to get that panel back on. Temps are good and it comes with 3 fans.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great case I love it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Had to do some small modifications to make everything fit. I do have an SLI setup so I had to trim down the HD enclosures just a bit to make everything fit. The elevated side panels may look awkward but, for cable management they are a dream come true. I prefer the side panel screws versus easy pop off panels and absence of unusually large handles taking up space.
customer_reviews.author: Erin E. Edmondson 11JUL1985

customer_reviews.title: They just keep getting better. Everything fits
customer_reviews.text: I've been building my own systems since the old Intel 8088 processor back in the 80's. Really impressed with how well everything went together in this case. They just keep getting better. Everything fits, everything works, and it looks good when you are done. Sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, doesn’t choke air
customer_reviews.text: It doesn’t choke like people say. Air intake is from the bottom and top. GPU doesn’t exceed 65C even with OC. Need to replace the stock fans with better ones but stock will get you by without OC.
customer_reviews.author: Really a person!

customer_reviews.title: Powerful case
customer_reviews.text: This case was purchased because I wanted to use it to switch my gaming PC from old case to new case. The case was easy to migrate. It has lot more space that it looks, and it has multiple fans to support the airflow. I have been using this case over 3 years now, and it's still working fine.
customer_reviews.author: Numan khaliq

customer_reviews.title: Looks great, Hard to Build in
customer_reviews.text: It was so difficult for me to build in this case because the cable managing space is tiny. It was most likely harder for me because I was using cable extensions so the front would look better. However, I was up for the challenge and when I finished the pc looked amazing. I would recommend this case to anybody advanced enough in PC building to deal with the cables.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Carrion

customer_reviews.title: Odd usb 3.0 connector breaking connector pins.
customer_reviews.text: Arrived damaged. Left USB bent. USB pin connection was somehow off... breaking Bluetooth 3.0 connector pins on 2 different motherboards. Vibrations can be crazy when everything resonates at a certain frequency. I had to use rubber mounts under the motherboard and had to put foam rubber on both removable doors to make this usable. Decent fan's for being rgb (or just r ) at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Jnuh Iscarabaid

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Gaming computer for youngest son. Looks very nice. Positives: (1) Legs that allow airflow to the power supply fan. (2) Easy to install 2.5" SSD drives (3) Fans are quiet. (4) 2 USB connectors on front. But it is a bit big and bulky, could have been a smaller and still easily fit everything. Overall very happy.
customer_reviews.author: PKC

customer_reviews.title: Great case
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this case for over a year now and I love it. It fits everything I need it to, and has room for my rather large graphics card. The only thing someone may want to consider is that since it is a mid-size tower, cable management can be difficult if you're looking for that clean look. Other than than, I find this case to be fantastic.
customer_reviews.author: elefantboy

customer_reviews.title: Nice and cheap
customer_reviews.text: Nice case for cheap. I had an issue with installing 2 120mm fans on the top housing because they we so close to my motherboard. I do like that I was able to unscrew the top off; most cases won't do that. Overall I'm very happy with the case.
customer_reviews.author: c0ker666

customer_reviews.title: I LOOOOVE THAT CASE
customer_reviews.text: Very beautiful, compact and beautiful. So easy to install components and manage cables and for the price you can’t beat it. Just buy it, believe me you won’t regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Lashello

customer_reviews.title: I started out in april to build my first PC ...
customer_reviews.text: I started out in april to build my first PC in 17 years. Well things have changed in 17 years. It was a little ackward at first. Almost intimidating. Just that computer have come a long ways in 17 years. well I knew enough to first look at what I wanted to do with it. Low to mid gaming. So. I said why not. so far it has been a adventure, and you were a part of nostalgia. Follow-up, The case held up and exceeded my expectations. Well built and full of options for future upgrades such as additional fans. Overall, a very thought out case.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: overall not that great
customer_reviews.text: It is a really good size, but the dust filter in the front is not great. It was a good case for $60 but I am definitely going to buy a new case ASAP
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Petray

customer_reviews.title: Looks beautiful!
customer_reviews.text: This case looks amazing! I went with the White/Red option, and it certainly stands out and turns heads! Cable management can get tricky though, as the closed side of the case only allows a very thin region to organize cables, I'd estimate about half an inch, but it's certainly doable. The only issue I have with it is that one of the side panels doesn't fit correctly into the case and a small gap is visible in the side, but this most likely happened in shipping and I will most likely be contacting Corsair about it. Overall, a beautiful case!
customer_reviews.author: Scott S.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Purchase
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent purchase for your PC build! It keeps my internals plenty cool and plenty of room to work with. On top of that the design gets better in person! There isn’t a disk drive with this case but not something an external drive couldn’t fix.
customer_reviews.author: M4NSW3R

customer_reviews.title: In case you were wondering about this case
customer_reviews.text: Good build quality. Looks good with the extra red fan in front. We'll probably by a third fan for the bottom of the case to improve the internal lighting. Easy to hide power and data cables. Wires for front panel were clearly marked. Good value for the price
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: if you want fans... this may not ...
customer_reviews.text: if you want fans... this may not be the case for you, running the corsair hydro series 3 fan system and it did not fit on top, had to modify the set up to run the fans on a pull in front of the case
customer_reviews.author: Bryant De La Campa

customer_reviews.title: Tons of Airflow
customer_reviews.text: This Case is very spacious. It has a total of 6 fan locations you can mount. It has great airflow and keeps my internals very cool. It was an easy installation of mobo and all internal parts. I did have a small problem where I killed an older SATA drive because I mounted my HDD in the case backwards. It would have been nice if corsair had put a stamp or arrow pointing the correct way to mount.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Tight fit but great air venting
customer_reviews.text: Bit tough to make my first computer with, but i loved working with it. Got to fix the rat's nest of wiring but overall it's functioning great, front audio ports are amazing, the two forward USB ports are also a huge plus. both fans spin up to max, are nearly silent even at topped out speeds and the air ventilation is superb! Was a bit tight getting the EVO 212 into it though.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Dotterer

customer_reviews.title: So glad i got this! really cool case!
customer_reviews.text: i do really love this box, but dang is it huge lol.. there is a lot of spaces for fans but the one in front of the hard drive section seems kind of hard to get to. the way my board is its impossible to use both fan slots on top but i have had no heating problems since so A+ from me! sorry if the pictures are ehh, i got lazy lol
customer_reviews.author: Jeno

customer_reviews.title: Bad Power Switch
customer_reviews.text: My guess is that the power switch itself was bad.....couldn't get it to turn on. Sent it back for a refund. Very tight case inside. It will fit most GPU's but there's really no extra room inside the case once the PSU and GPU are in. It was nice to move to a larger case. I can't write anything else about this case because it wouldn't power up.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Very Happy!!!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this case. The design made for a very simple and easy installation of all the gear. It has plenty of fan mounting points and if/when I decide to upgrade to a water cooled unit, it has a mounting point at the top of the chassis. I liked that tool-less mounting points for the hard drives and DVD players. I wouldn't hesitate to order another one. Best chassis I have purchased to date.
customer_reviews.author: Chuckw

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first computer build, and I never knew this would be so easy. This case is easy to use, very quiet, and overall great. When I looked at the price of the case, I thought that it would be extremely loud, and just a bad case, but when I finished the computer build, I was amazed. The only thing that was annoying, however, was the hard drive installation. After a little messing around, I finally made sense of it.
customer_reviews.author: Ki Song

customer_reviews.title: Great price, with great looks!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this case for my very first computer build. I was pleasantly surprised at the ease of assembly! Everything went together VERY smooth, and it was completed in a matter of a couple hours. It looks amazing and does everything I need it to. The one drawback I had was when it came to cable management. Though I could possibly chalk that up to my inexperience with building PC's. Overall it's a fantastic case for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Calum

customer_reviews.title: Great budget case
customer_reviews.text: This case is definitely better than my last one... I did have a few issues with clearance while building it up, but nothing major. Had to remove the fans I just put in to get the motherboard in, and can't have a fan in the bottom because my modular power supply is too long. Other than that it went together fine. My one and only suggestion for people buying this product... make sure your motherboard has enough fan connectors or buy y splitters. :-P
customer_reviews.author: Shaunie

customer_reviews.title: good bang for buck
customer_reviews.text: I got this put together today. the hydro CPU cooler made it a tight fit trying to get all the cables hooked up. so I would recommend hooking up CPU cable first before putting in a hydro one. more of a gee wiz then a default of the case. roomie enough for everything I need. I did use a PC build website for config issues prior, and none were had.
customer_reviews.author: nicole

customer_reviews.title: Yessir!
customer_reviews.text: I love this case. the intake fan that comes with it, it located a very good place. The airflow is excellent. I can hide most all of the cables and the thing is super quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Not your average joe

customer_reviews.title: so so
customer_reviews.text: Case looked good. You get what you pay for. Don't think I found any screw holes that were not misaligned. I gave up on it and bought a Fractal Design Define R6. Now that is a good case.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Decent case, comes with nice built in fans pretty good cable management. Minor panel gaps I’ve noticed but that might be my fault. Overall it’s good but there may be better options for the money. Stylistically it’s unique so it gets 4 stars from me.
customer_reviews.author: Park

customer_reviews.title: Great airflow, sharp design
customer_reviews.text: Great airflow, sharp design, and easy to disassemble. Able to have 7 total fans (frontx3,topx2,bottomx1,rearx1) so no stagnant air. if only 2 fans up front, can slide them up or down. fan controller works great. Only hiccup is how flimsy the bracket fills when placing a ssd in the drive bay. Could put ssd one on of the two side mounts though
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Bethke

customer_reviews.title: Great for Budget Builds!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case for my budget build. (Well it was suppose to be a budget build) I love the glass panel on the side. It comes with a red led fan and a normal fan for the exhaust in the back. You can find more reviews on youtube which will let you see the product more. I highly recommend this case for budget builds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be picky when receiving it
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted this case and what do i get? A completely annihilated computer case.
customer_reviews.author: logicaltwist

customer_reviews.title: ... other computers in different cases I've decided I absolutely hate this thing
customer_reviews.text: After having this case for a while and building a couple other computers in different cases I've decided I absolutely hate this thing. It is super cramped and unnecessarily difficult to build in. It doesn't have great storage areas for SSDs, and the power cord for your processor has no choice but to run awkwardly across your entire motherboard ruining any clean aesthetics. There are a lot of better options for less money.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: multiple spots for additional fans (if you want better cooling) and it was relatively easy to build
customer_reviews.text: Plenty of room, multiple spots for additional fans (if you want better cooling) and it was relatively easy to build. The rear fan only worked about half the time. I would have to stick a screw driver into the case to touch the blade to get it to start spinning. I tried plugging it into different fan ports on the MOBO and same thing. Setting up crossfire (2 AMD Graphics Cards) was a pain in the rear with the rear slots, I had to manually bend one just to get two r9 390's to plug into the MOBO.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Kirkpatrick

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy
customer_reviews.text: Too small you will need to make some modifications to fit your stuff forget about fitting a hd in there
customer_reviews.author: Abdulfattah

customer_reviews.title: Good bang for the buck, good quality for a cheap case, far from flimsy!
customer_reviews.text: Side panels screw holes suck and are very hard to get the screws back in once you take them out. I had to use a different screw than what it came with originally to get them back on securely.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: Great, well laid out case, with forward thinking design and features for the price.
customer_reviews.text: This is a well laid out case, with great, forward thinking design and features for the price. Optical drives being replaced by dedicated SSD bays was a brilliant decision IMO, and helps keep the case cool and feeling roomy. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: Bought this case so I could spend more on other components. No problems with component installs . Corsair puts their name on it and Ive used enough of their products to trust their design and function
customer_reviews.author: Rick Bain

customer_reviews.title: MY GORGEOUS RED DEVIL CASE BUILD 😍😍
customer_reviews.text: Assembled my first computer on my own with all of the usual bumps and problems but the case wasn't one of them! Made everything super easy and intuitive. LOVE the look of it. Functionality is a near 100% You could almost put anything you want in this case. VERY upgrade friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Aven

customer_reviews.title: Good Case
customer_reviews.text: Lots of room for a mid tower. Designed for a quick computer builder not a lot of craziness in the design. HDD bays were easy to use. Already has motherboard backers in place. Case cables are clear and ideally placed. Only wish it could hold more fans, six is a little low. Built a budget machine: 3820 I7, 680 GTX, 16GB of DDR3 RAM. 7200 RPM WD Blue.
customer_reviews.author: GlacierDonut

customer_reviews.title: It's ait
customer_reviews.text: First Corsair tower I've had and this one's not the best. I rather have built it in something like the coolermaster haf don't remember the number but the 50$ one. It's this one's ait.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Awsome case
customer_reviews.text: The case Is great I have had no issues with its interior or exterior build and there are no jaget edges and I have a beefy CPU noctua fan in it aswell and there is alot of space in it to move around I recommend this product for sure and I'd spend the extra money to get the 2 fans defently worth the buy
customer_reviews.author: Zack Woodson

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: I bought this case to build a system for my son. The case arrived fairly quickly. However, it was partially damaged. The the back edge of the panel with the transparent window was twisted, perhaps from a drop, and did not fit properly. However, I had to keep it as I needed to have the system built ASAP and did not have time to return.
customer_reviews.author: Tran-Dao

customer_reviews.title: I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.text: This case was easy to use. Plenty of room for cables, the fans are quiet, there are multiple tie down points....I love this case. I would say the only downside to the case is the lack of physical support for the motherboard. The board I chose does not reach the last set of screws, consequently the last 2 inches of the board 'flexes' when attaching the cables and memory. Aside from that, this case met my needs and then some.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for a budget case
customer_reviews.text: I've had an experience with a terrible case and this isn't one by any means. It has ideal space for cable management, two SSD bays, 3 HDD bays (i think), and has plenty of room for a long graphics. My favorite thing about this case is the amount of fans i can put in. If you're looking for a budget case this would be worthy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 13yo really likes it
customer_reviews.text: My 13yo son ordered this to switch out from his HP cover. It’s quite a bit larger and has extra slots to add to. The red light up streak is very clean looking. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Suddreth Fam

customer_reviews.title: Decent Case for a college budget!
customer_reviews.text: For my first all new part Build, this case was definitely worth the buy. My decision for buying the case was because it looked quite spiffy and was cheap. I really wish I looked at the dimensions beforehand, because I was surprised ._. I honestly though for a moment I bought some small case, but I had enough room to fit my Rx480 with ease! However, the side panel used for cable management isn't exactly the best, but you can probably work around that with enough twist ties and patience. Overall, great case!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I must have gotten a bad one, because the window panel does not line ...
customer_reviews.text: I must have gotten a bad one, because the window panel does not line up correctly so there is a small gap. The top panel where the back screws go do not line up (without wedging them in. And the cpu water cooler I already purchased wouldn't fit so now I had to order a completely different cpu fan
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: I've been mostly happy with this case
customer_reviews.text: I've been mostly happy with this case. Airflow and space are incredible; and I love the way it looks. My only issue is how hard it was to manage cables on the side of the case. There just aren't may tie-downs in places I would've wanted them–nor is there a lot of space for cables in general. Overall though, it's a great-looking and functional case that I'd give 5 stars to if it weren't for the lack of cable forethought.
customer_reviews.author: Ethan

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price. Easy to boof-clean out.
customer_reviews.text: I stuffed all my bits into it. IT'S ALIIIIIIIIIVE! 5/5
customer_reviews.author: Do Not Care Bear

customer_reviews.title: Great case for money; decent game case in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: Some of the reviews sort of ditch this case as a true gaming box. I disagree. I was quite effortlessly able to get a couple off the boxes installed. It's a little tight but the way they made the panels come out you don't have to jam your cables into box.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca L WeschTop Contributor: Fashion Design

customer_reviews.title: So much more room in a full tower but the price is pretty hard to beat at $57
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for - if you have the room, go with a full tower case. So much more room in a full tower but the price is pretty hard to beat at $57 USD
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Daniels

customer_reviews.title: Quality, Quantity, Worth it
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Price - Quality Cons: - Right side metal panel bends due to cables. - LED and Power cable wire on the front panel for lights easy to break off
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: I really like how everything is laid out
customer_reviews.text: Built my first computer in this case. I really like how everything is laid out,. the extended panel gives you quite a bit of room for cable management. The window is awesome. I did have to move the standoffs to get them to line up to my ASRock Z97 motherboard. The LED is a nice touch if you are into that sort of thing. Definitely get's my vote for a case in this price range.
customer_reviews.author: DR KAOTICA

customer_reviews.title: Future proof
customer_reviews.text: The case has a lot of potential for additional mods. Has everything you could possibly need. Cable management is too easy. Can fit any motherboard or gpu. Easily a $100 case but is probably cheaper because the aesthetics might not be desirable to other.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Would Recommend
customer_reviews.text: PROS: - Large and easy to build in. - Quality materials. - Amazing fans jncluded. - Looks amazing. CONS: - Bulky. - Not many chances for cable management.

customer_reviews.title: it is easy to achieve positive pressure in this case
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a new case for my new computer build and this one fit my needs very well. Plenty of room for my CoolerMaster Hyper 212 Evo and cable management. With proper fan setup, it is easy to achieve positive pressure in this case. Was packaged very well, no damage during shipment. Case is pretty durable. Just wish the see through part of the side panel was bigger, but oh well. Still, a very nice case.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathon Lane

customer_reviews.title: Like the size just not the tight fit
customer_reviews.text: I think this case met my needs. I wanted a mid tower case that still allowed for optical drives. To me the biggest downside was how tight the case was. I initially bought a heatsink but that wouldn't fit. Then I went with a smaller single liquid cooler which barely fit at the top (by the way, there is a way to make it fit. I saw someone cut their case to make it fit but you shouldn't do that!). In hindsight, I probably should have gone with a full size tower as it would have been easier to build.
customer_reviews.author: Prime1

customer_reviews.title: For the price! This case looks cool! Just one problem with usb slots.
customer_reviews.text: Most everything works great! Pros- -Lots of fan mounting places -Looks great -Has removable dust filters -Comes with 2 fans depending on which one you get Cons- -USB 3.0 slots on case stopped working after less than a month (luckly I have like 20 on my motherboard) -Plastic window isnt in that great of a place.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Cadieux

customer_reviews.title: Good case, but has some minor drawbacks
customer_reviews.text: Pretty decent case, only problem is that cable managing on it is pretty hard to do and there is no way to put a CD ROM in it. The way that the back panel is tapered inwards towards the edges causes there to only be just a tiny bit of room to put cables behind it, it is very hard to put anything through the the bottom cutouts. However once you get that sorted out it is a very nice case.
customer_reviews.author: Trevor Anglin

customer_reviews.title: My new go to for future builds!
customer_reviews.text: This has to be one of the best bangs for your buck in terms of cases in this price range. One of the best cases I have ever owned. Why spend $100 when you can be just as happy with this case, and put the saved cash towards more important components. Comes with two 120mm fans. One red LED intake fan, and one black exhaust fan.
customer_reviews.author: Mathew

customer_reviews.title: Very nice case
customer_reviews.text: Great price, nice materials, very light weight, lots of room, made install a breeze. My son is one happy camper.
customer_reviews.author: nothingness

customer_reviews.title: Nice box.
customer_reviews.text: Nice box...easy to run wires. Able to run many fans for great ventilation (though only used one of the top fan mounts; first fan spot would have made it too hard to change out ram if i needed too). And see-through side window gives an extra gamer appeal.
customer_reviews.author: MS

product_meta.title: CORSAIR Carbide SPEC-Omega Mid-Tower Gaming Case, Tempered Glass- Red
product_meta.description: Style:Tempered Glass| Size:Standard| Color:Black/RedThe Carbide Series SPEC-OMEGA is a mid-tower PC case with striking angular looks, integrated red LED lighting, and unique tempered glass front and side panels that ensure your system will always stand out. Two included CORSAIR SP120L cooling fans provide ample air flow, with Direct Airflow Path design delivers cool air straight to your hottest components. Upgrade your cooling with room for up to a 360mm, liquid cooling radiator in the front and up to six fan mounts. With an internal layout designed to make your build beautiful inside and out, liquid cooling radiator in the front and up to six fan mounts. With an internal layout designed to make your build beautiful inside and out, you'll find a wealth of cable tie-downs, routing holes and grommets. Built to show off your system and turn heads, this is the ultimate SPEC.
feature_bullets: Unmistakable Style: Ensure your system will always stand out – asymmetrical, angular design gives SPEC-OMEGA a bold, unique and dynamic look
Tempered Glass to Show off your Hardware: Why hide your system? Tempered glass side and front panels put your system on display unlike any other case
Built-in LED Lighting: Integrated front-panel white LED light strip and white LED-lit 120mm cooling fan add bright illumination and a dramatic styling
Two Included 120mm Fans and Direct Airflow Path: Keep your system cool inside and out with two CORSAIR
Cable Routing Cutouts and Tie Downs: With your system on display, SPEC OMEGA makes it easy to keep your cable routing neat, tidy, and out of the airflow path for better cooling

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars2,330 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
